md:
giải nghĩa từ "trinity" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan đến "trinity".

1. Trinity (n) - Tam vị (tín ngưỡng)
	* Meaning: The state of being threefold or triple; a group of three related things.
	* Example: The Holy Trinity is a central concept in Christianity.
	* Related words: triad, triplet, trio, triple

2. Trinity (n) - Trường đại học Trinity (tên trường)
	* Meaning: A university or college with this name.
	* Example: Trinity College is one of the oldest and most prestigious universities in Ireland.
	* Related words: university, college, institution, academia

3. Trinity (n) - Ba thể (vật lý)
	* Meaning: In physics, a trinity refers to a set of three particles or forces that are closely related or interconnected.
	* Example: The trinity of quarks, leptons, and gauge bosons is a fundamental concept in particle physics.
	* Related words: particle, force, physics, quantum

Note: The meanings and examples provided are based on the most common uses of the word "trinity". However, the word can have different meanings and connotations depending on the context and field of study.
html:
giải nghĩa từ "trinity" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan đến "trinity".

  1. Trinity (n) - Tam vị (tín ngưỡng)

    • Meaning: The state of being threefold or triple; a group of three related things.
    • Example: The Holy Trinity is a central concept in Christianity.
    • Related words: triad, triplet, trio, triple

  2. Trinity (n) - Trường đại học Trinity (tên trường)

    • Meaning: A university or college with this name.
    • Example: Trinity College is one of the oldest and most prestigious universities in Ireland.
    • Related words: university, college, institution, academia

  3. Trinity (n) - Ba thể (vật lý)

    • Meaning: In physics, a trinity refers to a set of three particles or forces that are closely related or interconnected.
    • Example: The trinity of quarks, leptons, and gauge bosons is a fundamental concept in particle physics.
    • Related words: particle, force, physics, quantum

Note: The meanings and examples provided are based on the most common uses of the word "trinity". However, the word can have different meanings and connotations depending on the context and field of study.
